title.narrative: 4.3 SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: Institutional and local actors have improved capacity to gradually increase social protection for poor and vulnerable children and adolescents in a performance, accountability and risk-informed framework, in rural and urban areasUNDAF/Produit 6.1 : Les mÃ©canismes de ciblage, de gouvernance, de suivi et Ã©valuation de la protection sociale sont amÃ©liorÃ©s, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Communication And Advocacy, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation, Evaluation (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Reducing Child Poverty, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The most vulnerable families, children and adolescents (boys and girls) benefit from a gradual increase in social protection coverage, equity of access to basic social services in their communities and opportunities for empowerment and development

title.narrative: Institutional and local actors have improved capacity to gradually increase social protection for poor and vulnerable children andadolescents in a performance, accountability and risk-informed framework, in rural and urban areasUNDAF/Produit 6.1 : Lesmecanismes de ciblage, de gouvernance, de suivi et evaluation de la protection sociale sont ameliores

description.narrative: In 2021, despite the pandemic, UNICEF continued its mandate as the lead agency for social protection in Senegal. This leadership has contributed to: (i) consolidating policy dialogue with all stakeholders; (ii) improving coordination of the social protection system and integration of interventions; (iii) strengthening public financial management in social protection and producing evidence for the sector. At operational level, UNICEF, in partnership with the Canadian Cooperation, has initiated social cash transfers for children of school age from 60,000 poor households in Senegal.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
